info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued November 24 at 10:35AM MST until November 24 at 11:15AM MST by NWS Great Falls MT
info.description:
The National Weather Service in Great Falls has issued a
* Snow Squall Warning for... Southern Jefferson County in southwestern Montana...
* Until 1115 AM MST.
* At 1034 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 10 miles southwest of Townsend to 8 miles northeast of Divide, moving east at 45 mph.
HAZARD...Flash freeze on roads. Whiteout conditions with near zero visibility associated with intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 35 mph.
SOURCE...Radar and webcams.
IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area.
This includes Interstate 90 from Homestake Pass to Whitehall.
Locations impacted include... Whitehall.
info.instruction:
Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges, and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for a sudden loss of traction.
Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents.

parameter.value: Snow Squall Warning til 11:15 AM MST. Sudden whiteouts. Icy roads. Slow down! -NWS
National Weather Service: Snow Squall Warning until 11:15 AM MST. Slow down or delay travel! Be ready for a sudden drop to near zero visibility and icy roads in heavy snow.

parameter.value: Aviso de Turbonada de Nieve hasta 11:15 AM MST. Pobre visibilidad! Reduzca la velocidad!

Servicio Nacional de Meteorologia: Aviso de Turbonada de Nieve hasta las 11:15 AM MST. Reduzca la velocidad o retrase su viaje! Preparese para una caida repentina de visibilidad cercana a cero y carreteras heladas en nevadas fuertes.
